articles.description: Douglas County’s Emergency Management Department is aiming to help its hardest to reach residents with two additions to its Rural Outreach Programs, according to a July 23 Douglas County Board of Commissioners press release.
articles.title: Douglas County outreach programs aim to build rural resilience

articles.author: Amelia Winkelman The News-Review
articles.description: The United States Small Business Administration (SBA) is in Roseburg offering loans for residences — including rentals — businesses and nonprofit organizations in Coos, Curry and Douglas counties affected by floods March 12-20.
articles.title: Loans available for homes, businesses, nonprofits, renters affected by March floods

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: Ashton Olson handed out items to create keys for children at Roseburg Public Library on Saturday morning during the annual Harry Potter Day.
articles.title: Wizards, snakes and all things fantastic show up to Roseburg Public Library

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: Douglas County Board of Commissioners, along with the county parks department, have announced the completion of repairs to eight county-owned boat ramps along the Umpqua River system.
articles.title: OSMB grant helps county complete repairs at eight boat ramps

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: ROSEBURG — A city release said along with Body Balance Yoga Center Director Alli Spooner and other instructors, free yoga sessions will be held in a tranquil setting in Stewart Park. This will take place east of the of the…
articles.title: Yoga in the Park continues every Saturday

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: Littered with debris, covered in sand and altogether ruined, Roseburg’s Happy Tails Dog Park was just one of many locations heavily damaged by widespread flooding on March 16.
articles.title: Welcome back, dog lovers: Roseburg's Happy Tails Dog Park to reopen after flood damages

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: In need of a brand new pair of cowboy boots, a mattress to match a bed frame or both? Now’s the time to shop as two locally-owned Roseburg businesses are closing down their physical storefronts.
articles.title: Cowboys and comforters: Roseburg businesses to close brick and mortar storefronts

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: GLENDALE — The first thing Misty Morningstar taught the children of Glendale was that in any emergency, call for help in a loud and obvious manner.
articles.title: Glendale nurse, paramedics teach first aid to kids

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: MYRTLE CREEK — The 40th Myrtle Creek Summer Festival swept through Millsite Park as the three-day event brought something for everybody.
articles.title: Rock crawling, water gaming, cornhole tossing and more in Myrtle Creek

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Clubhouse by Round Table Pizza in Roseburg closes permanently Thursday due to low revenue. Manager Charles Crosier informed customers via Facebook, lamenting the loss of the restaurant's community connections. Staff are already seeking new employment.
articles.title: Clubhouse by Round Table Pizza in Roseburg Closing Permanently

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: In the wake of afternoon thunderstorms that swept over the Cascade Range this week, USDA Forest Service crews are actively responding to multiple new fire starts in the Diamond Lake District. Rapid spotting of smoke plumes has enabled swift deployment of aerial and ground resources to keep these incidents small
articles.title: New Wildfires Ignite in Cascade Range Following Recent Thunderstorms

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A Douglas County man, Izaiah Alvarez, 26, is facing charges including first-degree rape after an alleged assault at a Roseburg home. The victim reported waking to the incident. Alvarez claims it was consensual. He is being held on $50,000 bail. The case remains under investigation.
articles.title: Douglas County Man Charged in Roseburg Assault Case

articles.author: News Staff
articles.description: Roseburg's Happy Tails Dog Park is set to reopen on Friday, Aug. 1, after undergoing significant repairs due to flood damage. According to Roseburg Parks and Recreation, the park will be ready by the end of the workday.
articles.title: Roseburg's Happy Tails Dog Park reopens after flood repairs

articles.author: Chelsea Deffenbacher
articles.description: A Douglas County man is facing serious charges following accusations of assaulting a woman in her home.
articles.title: Roseburg man charged with rape while victim slept on couch
